paper.title: A Tableau-Based Characterisation for Default Logic
paper.venue: European Conference on Symbolic and Quantitative Approaches to Reasoning and Uncertainty
paper.abstract: This paper has two :[4],"first give a necessary and sufficient criterion for the existence of extension of default theories in the general :[23],"we present a new, efficient and clear method for computing extensions and deriving formulae of default theory in the general case. It is based on the semantic tableaux method [Smullyan 1968] and works for default theories with a finite set of defaults that are formulated over a decidable subset of first-order logic. We prove that all extensions (if any) of a default theory can be produced by constructing the semantic tableau of one formula built from the general laws and the default consequences.
